comment: One of the best teachers. Very understanding and lenient. He will help you during the lab if you are stuck on anything. Although your grade is made of only 10 experiments, they are easy to get good grades on if you show up and show all your work in the lab report. Take this teacher if you can.
Best professor ever. Got me to love physics, which I hated before.

It was a lab class, which are easy 100s, but during the lecture sections he was very good at explaining concepts and was always helpful with doing the experiment. Very nice man, I wish I took his lecture class.

He is a fairly new professor which is why there aren't many reviews. Fear not, he is a great professor for physics 2. As long as you attend lectures at least twice a week, go to the breakout sessions when you can, and know how to use formula sheets to figure out problems, you're in the clear. Do note that he wants you to show all of your work.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Physics is not my major so I was really nervous to take the class. This professor was so helpful and patient and explained things well. I definitely recommend taking him if you have to take physics!

He is an awesome teacher. He really cares about students not just learning physics but enjoying it. If you show up and make a genuine effort you'll pass his class. Attendance isn't mandatory but I highly recommend going to both lecture and recitation as he'll help you work through the homework problems. I hardly had any hw left after.

Easy A. He gives you the formulas and it is mostly just using those with not too much practical knowledge needed. Plenty of time to do the homework. Doesn't seem to build off of Physics 1 at all, and is actually easier. Very low stress class that takes little time outside of class to succeed.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class
